bridge-type.label: Milight Bridge (first edition)
bridge-type.description: A Milight/Easybulb bridge. This bridge cannot handle newer light bulbs (2016+) of the aforementioned manufacturers.

parameter.name: host
parameter.label: IP or Host Name
parameter.description: Will be resolved by discovery if auto configured

parameter.name: repeat
parameter.label: Repeat commands
parameter.description: Usually the bridge receives all commands albeit UDP is used. But the actual bulbs might be slightly out of bridge radio range and it sometimes helps to send commands multiple times.

parameter.name: delayTime
parameter.label: Wait between commands (ms)
parameter.description: Time to wait before sending another command to the bridge. It is safe to have a wait time of 1/10s but usually sufficient to just wait 50ms. If the value is too high, commands queue up.

parameter.name: port
parameter.label: Custom port
parameter.description: You can set a custom port that will take precedence over the default port which is selected depending on the bridge version: Version 6 uses 5987, Version 3/4/5 uses 8899. Version 2 uses 50000.

parameter.name: bridgeid
parameter.label: Bridge ID
parameter.description: The mac address of the bridge in upper case letters without delimiter. This is used to check if the given IP corresponds to the right device. The bridge is set offline if the device does not respond with the correct Bride ID and a re-detection is started. Useful for DHCP environments where IPs may change over time, after power outage etc. Will be resolved by discovery if auto configured.

parameter.name: refreshTime
parameter.label: Refresh interval
parameter.description: Interval in seconds to check for device presence. The Bridge ID is used to check if the IP is still the right one.

thing-type.label: Color bulb (first edition)
thing-type.description: RGB bulb with white channel. No saturation control. If the set saturation is below a threshold of 50%, the bulb turns into white mode.

parameter.name: zone
parameter.label: Zone
parameter.description: A milight bulb can be assigned to zone 0-4. zone 0 controls all bulbs of that type.

thing-type.label: Cold/warm white bulb (first edition)
thing-type.description: White bulb for the older bridge (up to 2016)

parameter.name: zone
parameter.label: Zone
parameter.description: A milight bulb can be assigned to zone 0-4. zone 0 controls all bulbs of that type.
